intro: Megaclinium jespersenii, commonly known as the Jespersen's sedge, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
